body: @nitsanw can you check ? We upgraded to a new version of jctools ...
Bugger :-(, will add a safe version and cut a release ASAP.

issue.title: Split JvmInfo into unsafe and portable components.
issue.body:
Many classes access how many CPUs on a system which sadly also results in a call to unsafe during clinit which is not suitable for Android users.

See https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/7117#issuecomment-322972545 for example

Essentially all that's been done here is to split it into unsafe and portable variants. Manually tracing through the class hierarchy indicates to me this should be sufficient to ensure the 'atomic' queues are portable and resolve this issue.

body: @nitsanw <3... Let me know once ready or even better just provide a pr to update the version we are using once it is ready...
I found this  bug  on  Android device 魅蓝M5，the  netty-all-4.1.15.Final-20170819.120514-18.jar   is not   fix  .

issue.title: Update JCTools version, fixes #7117

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

Remove Unsafe dependency for Atomic queues in JCTools, resolved in version 2.1.0

Modification:

Change pom JCTools version

Result:

Fixes #7117
